meanings.definition: To move or jump suddenly or rapidly.
meanings.sent1: The cat springed onto the table to catch the mouse.
meanings.sent2: The rabbit springed out of the bush when it heard a noise.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel springed up the tree to escape the barking dog.
meanings.sent4: The athlete springed across the finish line, winning the race.
meanings.sent5: The ballerina springed gracefully across the stage, captivating the audience.

meanings.sent1: The idea springed from a conversation between friends.
meanings.sent2: The tradition of gift-giving springed from ancient customs.
meanings.sent3: The rumor springed from a misunderstanding and spread quickly.
meanings.sent4: Hope springed in their hearts as they saw the first signs of spring.
meanings.sent5: Laughter springed from the children playing together in the park.

meanings.definition: To set or wind a clock or watch.
meanings.sent1: She carefully springed the antique clock to make it chime.
meanings.sent2: He always springed his watch before starting his day.
meanings.sent3: Grandpa springed the old pocket watch, its gears clicking softly.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic springed the clock in the tower to keep time accurately.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the clock being springed echoed through the room.

meanings.sent1: The mattress was so comfortable because it was springed.
meanings.sent2: The trampoline was bouncy and fun due to its springed surface.
meanings.sent3: The shoes had a springed sole that made walking feel light and easy.
meanings.sent4: The car had a smooth ride thanks to its springed suspension.
meanings.sent5: The toy had a springed mechanism that made it jump and flip unpredictably.
